ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A great chance to read Csaire closely and get a feel for teaching the material. Yes, I would recommend the class, whether or not Professor Miller chooses to continue teaching it as a student-run seminar.

I think the syllabus provides an accurate summary. I would recommend it for the general experience - particularly that of having to teach a seminar. I remain in two minds about Csaire, but that is perhaps a subjective response.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course "deepened" my knowledge in a few ways: we read a lot of poetry, which is something I haven't gotten much of at Yale; my knowledge of Caribbean francophone literature was rather poor before the class; I had never taught a two-hour seminar, so pedagogically speaking the class provided me with useful skills for the profession.

The experience of teaching literature was very useful, as highlighted above. When it comes to writing a prospectus, having done a comprehensive survey of a single author may come in useful as a model of how to focus in on a single author or topic.
